text: Sire is a 1991 novel by the French writer Jean Raspail. It tells the story of how monarchy returns to France as the 18-year-old Philippe Pharamond de Bourbon ascends the throne in 1999. The novel received the Grand prix du roman de la Ville de Paris and the Alfred de Vigny Prize. ==References== ==External links== * Sire at the writer's website Category:1991 French novels Category:Fiction set in 1999 Category:French-language novels Category:Novels about royalty Category:Novels by Jean Raspail Category:Novels set in the 1990s
title: Sire (novel)
